1551#@log_function_call
1552def preprocess_img_data(settings):
1553    
1554    from .plot import plot_arrays
1555    from .utils import _run_test_mode, _get_regex
1556    from .settings import set_default_settings_preprocess_img_data
1557    
1558    """
1559    Preprocesses image data by converting z-stack images to maximum intensity projection (MIP) images.
1560
1561    Args:
1562        src (str): The source directory containing the z-stack images.
1563        metadata_type (str, optional): The type of metadata associated with the images. Defaults to 'cellvoyager'.
1564        custom_regex (str, optional): The custom regular expression pattern used to match the filenames of the z-stack images. Defaults to None.
1565        cmap (str, optional): The colormap used for plotting. Defaults to 'inferno'.
1566        figuresize (int, optional): The size of the figure for plotting. Defaults to 15.
1567        normalize (bool, optional): Whether to normalize the images. Defaults to False.
1568        nr (int, optional): The number of images to preprocess. Defaults to 1.
1569        plot (bool, optional): Whether to plot the images. Defaults to False.
1570        mask_channels (list, optional): The channels to use for masking. Defaults to [0, 1, 2].
1571        batch_size (list, optional): The number of images to process in each batch. Defaults to [100, 100, 100].
1572        timelapse (bool, optional): Whether the images are from a timelapse experiment. Defaults to False.
1573        remove_background (bool, optional): Whether to remove the background from the images. Defaults to False.
1574        backgrounds (int, optional): The number of background images to use for background removal. Defaults to 100.
1575        lower_percentile (float, optional): The lower percentile used for background removal. Defaults to 1.
1576        save_dtype (type, optional): The data type used for saving the preprocessed images. Defaults to np.float32.
1577        randomize (bool, optional): Whether to randomize the order of the images. Defaults to True.
1578        all_to_mip (bool, optional): Whether to convert all images to MIP. Defaults to False.
1579        pick_slice (bool, optional): Whether to pick a specific slice based on the provided skip mode. Defaults to False.
1580        skip_mode (str, optional): The skip mode used to filter out specific slices. Defaults to '01'.
1581        settings (dict, optional): Additional settings for preprocessing. Defaults to {}.
1582
1583    Returns:
1584        None
1585    """
1586    
1587    src = settings['src']
1588    valid_ext = ['tif', 'tiff', 'png', 'jpeg']
1589    files = os.listdir(src)
1590    extensions = [file.split('.')[-1] for file in files]
1591    extension_counts = Counter(extensions)
1592    most_common_extension = extension_counts.most_common(1)[0][0]
1593    img_format = None
1594    
1595    delete_empty_subdirectories(src)
1596
1597    # Check if the most common extension is one of the specified image formats
1598    if most_common_extension in valid_ext:
1599        img_format = f'.{most_common_extension}'
1600        print(f'Found {extension_counts[most_common_extension]} {most_common_extension} files')
1601    else:
1602        print(f'Could not find any {valid_ext} files in {src} only found {extension_counts[0]}')
1603        
1604        if os.path.exists(os.path.join(src,'stack')):
1605            print('Found existing stack folder.')
1606        if os.path.exists(os.path.join(src,'channel_stack')):
1607            print('Found existing channel_stack folder.')
1608        if os.path.exists(os.path.join(src,'norm_channel_stack')):
1609            print('Found existing norm_channel_stack folder. Skipping preprocessing')
1610            return settings, src
1611        
1612    mask_channels = [settings['nucleus_channel'], settings['cell_channel'], settings['pathogen_channel']]
1613    backgrounds = [settings['nucleus_background'], settings['cell_background'], settings['pathogen_background']]
1614    
1615    settings, metadata_type, custom_regex, nr, plot, batch_size, timelapse, lower_percentile, randomize, all_to_mip, pick_slice, skip_mode, cmap, figuresize, normalize, save_dtype, test_mode, test_images, random_test = set_default_settings_preprocess_img_data(settings)
1616    
1617    regex = _get_regex(metadata_type, img_format, custom_regex)
1618    
1619    if test_mode:
1620
1621        print(f'Running spacr in test mode')
1622        settings['plot'] = True
1623        try:
1624            os.rmdir(os.path.join(src, 'test'))
1625            print(f"Deleted test directory: {os.path.join(src, 'test')}")
1626        except OSError as e:
1627            print(f"Error deleting test directory: {e}")
1628            print(f"Delete manually before running test mode")
1629            pass
1630
1631        src = _run_test_mode(settings['src'], regex, timelapse, test_images, random_test)
1632        settings['src'] = src
1633    
1634    stack_path = os.path.join(src, 'stack')
1635    if img_format == None:
1636        if not os.path.exists(stack_path):
1637            _merge_channels(src, plot=False)   
1638   
1639    if not os.path.exists(stack_path):
1640        try:
1641            if not img_format == None:
1642                if timelapse:
1643                    _move_to_chan_folder(src, regex, timelapse, metadata_type)
1644                else:
1645                    img_format = ['.tif', '.tiff', '.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg', '.bmp', '.nd2', '.czi', '.lif']
1646                    _rename_and_organize_image_files(src, regex, batch_size, pick_slice, skip_mode, metadata_type, img_format)
1647                    
1648                    #Make sure no batches will be of only one image
1649                    all_imgs = len(stack_path)
1650                    full_batches = all_imgs // batch_size
1651                    last_batch_size = all_imgs % batch_size
1652                    
1653                    # Check if the last batch is of size 1
1654                    if last_batch_size == 1:
1655                        # If there's only one batch and its size is 1, it's also an issue
1656                        if full_batches == 0:
1657                            raise ValueError("Only one batch of size 1 detected. Adjust the batch size.")
1658                        # If the last batch is of size 1, merge it with the second last batch
1659                        elif full_batches > 0:
1660                            print(f"all images: {all_imgs},  full batch: {full_batches}, last batch: {last_batch_size}")
1661                            raise ValueError("Last batch of size 1 detected. Adjust the batch size.")
1662        
1663                nr_channel_folders = _merge_channels(src, plot=False)
1664                
1665                if len(settings['channels']) != nr_channel_folders:
1666                    print(f"Number of channels does not match number of channel folders. channels: {settings['channels']} channel folders: {nr_channel_folders}")
1667                    new_channels = list(range(nr_channel_folders))
1668                    print(f"Changing channels from {settings['channels']} to {new_channels}")
1669                    settings['channels'] = new_channels
1670
1671                if timelapse:
1672                    _create_movies_from_npy_per_channel(stack_path, fps=2)
1673
1674                if plot:
1675                    print(f'plotting {nr} images from {src}/stack')
1676                    plot_arrays(stack_path, figuresize, cmap, nr=nr, normalize=normalize)
1677
1678                if all_to_mip:
1679                    _mip_all(stack_path)
1680                    if plot:
1681                        print(f'plotting {nr} images from {src}/stack')
1682                        plot_arrays(stack_path, figuresize, cmap, nr=nr, normalize=normalize)
1683        except Exception as e:
1684            print(f"Error: {e}")
1685    
1686    concatenate_and_normalize(src=stack_path,
1687                              channels=mask_channels,
1688                              save_dtype=np.float32,
1689                              settings=settings)
1690
1691    #if plot:
1692    #    _plot_4D_arrays(src+'/norm_channel_stack', nr_npz=1, nr=nr)
1693
1694    return settings, src
1695    
1696def _check_masks(batch, batch_filenames, output_folder):
1697    """
1698    Check the masks in a batch and filter out the ones that already exist in the output folder.
1699
1700    Args:
1701        batch (list): List of masks.
1702        batch_filenames (list): List of filenames corresponding to the masks.
1703        output_folder (str): Path to the output folder.
1704
1705    Returns:
1706        tuple: A tuple containing the filtered batch (numpy array) and the filtered filenames (list).
1707    """
1708    # Create a mask for filenames that are already present in the output folder
1709    existing_files_mask = [not os.path.isfile(os.path.join(output_folder, filename)) for filename in batch_filenames]
1710
1711    # Use the mask to filter the batch and batch_filenames
1712    filtered_batch = [b for b, exists in zip(batch, existing_files_mask) if exists]
1713    filtered_filenames = [f for f, exists in zip(batch_filenames, existing_files_mask) if exists]
1714
1715    return np.array(filtered_batch), filtered_filenames
1716
1717def _get_avg_object_size(masks):
1718    """
1719    Calculate the average size of objects in a list of masks.
1720
1721    Parameters:
1722    masks (list): A list of masks representing objects.
1723
1724    Returns:
1725    float: The average size of objects in the masks. Returns 0 if no objects are found.
1726    """
1727    object_areas = []
1728    for mask in masks:
1729        # Check if the mask is a 2D or 3D array and is not empty
1730        if mask.ndim in [2, 3] and np.any(mask):
1731            properties = measure.regionprops(mask)
1732            object_areas += [prop.area for prop in properties]
1733        else:
1734            if not np.any(mask):
1735                print(f"Mask is empty. ")
1736            if not mask.ndim in [2, 3]:
1737                print(f"Mask is not in the correct format. dim: {mask.ndim}")
1738            continue
1739
1740    if object_areas:
1741        return sum(object_areas) / len(object_areas)
1742    else:
1743        return 0  # Return 0 if no objects are found

1745def _save_figure(fig, src, text, dpi=300, i=1, all_folders=1):
1746    from .utils import print_progress
1747    """
1748    Save a figure to a specified location.
1749
1750    Parameters:
1751    fig (matplotlib.figure.Figure): The figure to be saved.
1752    src (str): The source file path.
1753    text (str): The text to be included in the figure name.
1754    dpi (int, optional): The resolution of the saved figure. Defaults to 300.
1755    """
1756
1757    save_folder = os.path.dirname(src)
1758    obj_type = os.path.basename(src)
1759    name = os.path.basename(save_folder)
1760    save_folder = os.path.join(save_folder, 'figure')
1761    os.makedirs(save_folder, exist_ok=True)
1762    fig_name = f'{obj_type}_{name}_{text}.pdf'        
1763    save_location = os.path.join(save_folder, fig_name)
1764    fig.savefig(save_location, bbox_inches='tight', dpi=dpi)
1765
1766    files_processed = i
1767    files_to_process = all_folders
1768    print_progress(files_processed, files_to_process, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type="Saving Figures")
1769    print(f'Saved single cell figure: {os.path.basename(save_location)}')
1770    plt.close(fig)
1771    del fig
1772    gc.collect()

1774def _read_and_join_tables(db_path, table_names=['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'png_list']):
1775    """
1776    Reads and joins tables from a SQLite database.
1777
1778    Args:
1779        db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database file.
1780        table_names (list, optional): The names of the tables to read and join. Defaults to ['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'png_list'].
1781
1782    Returns:
1783        pandas.DataFrame: The joined DataFrame containing the data from the specified tables, or None if an error occurs.
1784    """
1785    from .utils import rename_columns_in_db
1786    rename_columns_in_db(db_path)
1787    
1788    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
1789    dataframes = {}
1790    for table_name in table_names:
1791        try:
1792            dataframes[table_name] = pd.read_sql(f"SELECT * FROM {table_name}", conn)
1793        except (sqlite3.OperationalError, pd.io.sql.DatabaseError) as e:
1794            print(f"Table {table_name} not found in the database.")
1795            print(e)
1796    conn.close()
1797    if 'png_list' in dataframes:
1798        png_list_df = dataframes['png_list'][['cell_id', 'png_path', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID']].copy()
1799        png_list_df['cell_id'] = png_list_df['cell_id'].str[1:].astype(int)
1800        png_list_df.rename(columns={'cell_id': 'object_label'}, inplace=True)
1801        if 'cell' in dataframes:
1802            join_cols = ['object_label', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID','fieldID']
1803            dataframes['cell'] = pd.merge(dataframes['cell'], png_list_df, on=join_cols, how='left')
1804        else:
1805            print("Cell table not found in database tables.")
1806            return png_list_df
1807    for entity in ['nucleus', 'pathogen']:
1808        if entity in dataframes:
1809            numeric_cols = dataframes[entity].select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
1810            non_numeric_cols = dataframes[entity].select_dtypes(exclude=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
1811            agg_dict = {col: 'mean' for col in numeric_cols}
1812            agg_dict.update({col: 'first' for col in non_numeric_cols if col not in ['cell_id', 'prcf']})
1813            grouping_cols = ['cell_id', 'prcf']
1814            agg_df = dataframes[entity].groupby(grouping_cols).agg(agg_dict)
1815            agg_df['count_' + entity] = dataframes[entity].groupby(grouping_cols).size()
1816            dataframes[entity] = agg_df
1817    joined_df = None
1818    if 'cell' in dataframes:
1819        joined_df = dataframes['cell']
1820    if 'cytoplasm' in dataframes:
1821        joined_df = pd.merge(joined_df, dataframes['cytoplasm'], on=['object_label', 'prcf'], how='left', suffixes=('', '_cytoplasm'))
1822    for entity in ['nucleus', 'pathogen']:
1823        if entity in dataframes:
1824            joined_df = pd.merge(joined_df, dataframes[entity], left_on=['object_label', 'prcf'], right_index=True, how='left', suffixes=('', f'_{entity}'))
1825    return joined_df
1826

1828    """
1829    Save the settings dictionary to a SQLite database.
1830
1831    Args:

1833
1834    Returns:
1835        None
1836    """

1839    # Convert all values in the 'setting_value' column to strings
1840    settings_df['setting_value'] = settings_df['setting_value'].apply(str)
1841    display(settings_df)

1852def _save_mask_timelapse_as_gif(masks, tracks_df, path, cmap, norm, filenames):
1853    """
1854    Save a timelapse animation of masks as a GIF.
1855
1856    Parameters:
1857    - masks (list): List of mask frames.
1858    - tracks_df (pandas.DataFrame): DataFrame containing track information.
1859    - path (str): Path to save the GIF file.
1860    - cmap (str or matplotlib.colors.Colormap): Colormap for displaying the masks.
1861    - norm (matplotlib.colors.Normalize): Normalization for the colormap.
1862    - filenames (list): List of filenames corresponding to each mask frame.
1863
1864    Returns:
1865    None
1866    """
1867    # Set the face color for the figure to black
1868    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(50, 50), facecolor='black')
1869    ax.set_facecolor('black')  # Set the axes background color to black
1870    ax.axis('off')  # Turn off the axis
1871    plt.subplots_adjust(left=0, right=1, top=1, bottom=0, wspace=0, hspace=0)  # Adjust the subplot edges
1872
1873    filename_text_obj = None  # Initialize a variable to keep track of the text object
1874
1875    def _update(frame):
1876        """
1877        Update the frame of the animation.
1878
1879        Parameters:
1880        - frame (int): The frame number to update.
1881
1882        Returns:
1883        None
1884        """
1885        nonlocal filename_text_obj  # Reference the nonlocal variable to update it
1886        if filename_text_obj is not None:
1887            filename_text_obj.remove()  # Remove the previous text object if it exists
1888
1889        ax.clear()  # Clear the axis to draw the new frame
1890        ax.axis('off')  # Ensure axis is still off after clearing
1891        current_mask = masks[frame]
1892        ax.imshow(current_mask, cmap=cmap, norm=norm)
1893        ax.set_title(f'Frame: {frame}', fontsize=24, color='white')
1894
1895        # Add the filename as text on the figure
1896        filename_text = filenames[frame]  # Get the filename corresponding to the current frame
1897        filename_text_obj = fig.text(0.5, 0.01, filename_text, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=20, color='white')  # Adjust text position, size, and color as needed
1898
1899        # Annotate each object with its label number from the mask
1900        for label_value in np.unique(current_mask):
1901            if label_value == 0: continue  # Skip background
1902            y, x = np.mean(np.where(current_mask == label_value), axis=1)
1903            ax.text(x, y, str(label_value), color='white', fontsize=24, ha='center', va='center')
1904
1905        # Overlay tracks
1906        if tracks_df is not None:
1907            for track in tracks_df['track_id'].unique():
1908                _track = tracks_df[tracks_df['track_id'] == track]
1909                ax.plot(_track['x'], _track['y'], '-w', linewidth=1)
1910
1911    anim = FuncAnimation(fig, _update, frames=len(masks), blit=False)
1912    anim.save(path, writer='pillow', fps=2, dpi=80)  # Adjust DPI for size/quality
1913    plt.close(fig)
1914    print(f'Saved timelapse to {path}')
1915
1916def _save_object_counts_to_database(arrays, object_type, file_names, db_path, added_string):
1917    """
1918    Save the counts of unique objects in masks to a SQLite database.
1919
1920    Args:
1921        arrays (List[np.ndarray]): List of masks.
1922        object_type (str): Type of object.
1923        file_names (List[str]): List of file names corresponding to the masks.
1924        db_path (str): Path to the SQLite database.
1925        added_string (str): Additional string to append to the count type.
1926
1927    Returns:
1928        None
1929    """
1930    def _count_objects(mask):
1931        """Count unique objects in a mask, assuming 0 is the background."""
1932        unique, counts = np.unique(mask, return_counts=True)
1933        # Assuming 0 is the background label, remove it from the count
1934        if unique[0] == 0:
1935            return len(unique) - 1
1936        return len(unique)
1937
1938    records = []
1939    for mask, file_name in zip(arrays, file_names):
1940        object_count = _count_objects(mask)
1941        count_type = f"{object_type}{added_string}"
1942
1943        # Append a tuple of (file_name, count_type, object_count) to the records list
1944        records.append((file_name, count_type, object_count))
1945
1946    # Connect to the database
1947    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
1948    cursor = conn.cursor()
1949
1950    # Create the table if it doesn't exist
1951    cursor.execute('''
1952    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object_counts (
1953        file_name TEXT,
1954        count_type TEXT,
1955        object_count INTEGER,
1956        PRIMARY KEY (file_name, count_type)
1957    )
1958    ''')
1959
1960    # Batch insert or update the object counts
1961    cursor.executemany('''
1962    INSERT INTO object_counts (file_name, count_type, object_count)
1963    VALUES (?, ?, ?)
1964    ON CONFLICT(file_name, count_type) DO UPDATE SET
1965    object_count = excluded.object_count
1966    ''', records)
1967
1968    # Commit changes and close the database connection
1969    conn.commit()
1970    conn.close()
1971
1972def _create_database(db_path):
1973    """
1974    Creates a SQLite database at the specified path.
1975
1976    Args:
1977        db_path (str): The path where the database should be created.
1978
1979    Returns:
1980        None
1981    """
1982    conn = None
1983    try:
1984        conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
1985    except Exception as e:
1986        print(e)
1987    finally:
1988        if conn:
1989            conn.close()

1991def _load_and_concatenate_arrays(src, channels, cell_chann_dim, nucleus_chann_dim, pathogen_chann_dim):
1992
1993    from .utils import print_progress
1994
1995    """
1996    Load and concatenate arrays from multiple folders.
1997
1998    Args:
1999        src (str): The source directory containing the arrays.
2000        channels (list): List of channel indices to select from the arrays.
2001        cell_chann_dim (int): Dimension of the cell channel.
2002        nucleus_chann_dim (int): Dimension of the nucleus channel.
2003        pathogen_chann_dim (int): Dimension of the pathogen channel.
2004
2005    Returns:
2006        None
2007    """
2008    folder_paths = [os.path.join(src+'/stack')]
2009
2010    if cell_chann_dim is not None or os.path.exists(os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'cell_mask_stack')):
2011        folder_paths = folder_paths + [os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack','cell_mask_stack')]
2012    if nucleus_chann_dim is not None or os.path.exists(os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'nucleus_mask_stack')):
2013        folder_paths = folder_paths + [os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack','nucleus_mask_stack')]
2014    if pathogen_chann_dim is not None or os.path.exists(os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'pathogen_mask_stack')):
2015        folder_paths = folder_paths + [os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack','pathogen_mask_stack')]
2016
2017    output_folder = src+'/merged'
2018    reference_folder = folder_paths[0]
2019    os.makedirs(output_folder, exist_ok=True)
2020
2021    count=0
2022    all_imgs = len(os.listdir(reference_folder))
2023    time_ls = []
2024    # Iterate through each file in the reference folder
2025    for idx, filename in enumerate(os.listdir(reference_folder)):
2026        start = time.time()
2027        stack_ls = []
2028        if filename.endswith('.npy'):
2029            count += 1
2030
2031            # Check if this file exists in all the other specified folders
2032            exists_in_all_folders = all(os.path.isfile(os.path.join(folder, filename)) for folder in folder_paths)
2033
2034            if exists_in_all_folders:
2035                # Load and potentially modify the array from the reference folder
2036                ref_array_path = os.path.join(reference_folder, filename)
2037                concatenated_array = np.load(ref_array_path)
2038
2039                if channels is not None:
2040                    concatenated_array = np.take(concatenated_array, channels, axis=2)
2041
2042                # Add the array from the reference folder to 'stack_ls'
2043                stack_ls.append(concatenated_array)
2044
2045                # For each of the other folders, load the array and add it to 'stack_ls'
2046                for folder in folder_paths[1:]:
2047                    array_path = os.path.join(folder, filename)
2048                    #array = np.load(array_path)
2049                    array = np.load(array_path, allow_pickle=True)
2050                    if array.ndim == 2:
2051                        array = np.expand_dims(array, axis=-1)  # Add an extra dimension if the array is 2D
2052                    stack_ls.append(array)
2053
2054            if len(stack_ls) > 0:
2055                stack_ls = [np.expand_dims(arr, axis=-1) if arr.ndim == 2 else arr for arr in stack_ls]
2056                unique_shapes = {arr.shape[:-1] for arr in stack_ls}
2057                if len(unique_shapes) > 1:
2058                    #max_dims = np.max(np.array(list(unique_shapes)), axis=0)
2059                    # Determine the maximum length of tuples in unique_shapes
2060                    max_tuple_length = max(len(shape) for shape in unique_shapes)
2061                    # Pad shorter tuples with zeros to make them all the same length
2062                    padded_shapes = [shape + (0,) * (max_tuple_length - len(shape)) for shape in unique_shapes]
2063                    # Now create a NumPy array and find the maximum dimensions
2064                    max_dims = np.max(np.array(padded_shapes), axis=0)
2065                    print(f'Warning: arrays with multiple shapes found. Padding arrays to max X,Y dimentions {max_dims}')
2066                    #print(f'Warning: arrays with multiple shapes found. Padding arrays to max X,Y dimentions {max_dims}', end='\r', flush=True)
2067                    padded_stack_ls = []
2068                    for arr in stack_ls:
2069                        pad_width = [(0, max_dim - dim) for max_dim, dim in zip(max_dims, arr.shape[:-1])]
2070                        pad_width.append((0, 0))
2071                        padded_arr = np.pad(arr, pad_width)
2072                        padded_stack_ls.append(padded_arr)
2073                    # Concatenate the padded arrays along the channel dimension (last dimension)
2074                    stack = np.concatenate(padded_stack_ls, axis=-1)
2075
2076                else:
2077                    stack = np.concatenate(stack_ls, axis=-1)
2078
2079                if stack.shape[-1] > concatenated_array.shape[-1]:
2080                    output_path = os.path.join(output_folder, filename)
2081                    np.save(output_path, stack)
2082        
2083        stop = time.time()
2084        duration = stop - start
2085        time_ls.append(duration)
2086        files_processed = idx+1
2087        files_to_process = all_imgs
2088        print_progress(files_processed, files_to_process, n_jobs=1, time_ls=time_ls, batch_size=None, operation_type="Merging Arrays")
2089
2090    return
2091    
2092def _read_db(db_loc, tables):
2093    """
2094    Read data from a SQLite database.
2095
2096    Parameters:
2097    - db_loc (str): The location of the SQLite database file.
2098    - tables (list): A list of table names to read from.
2099
2100    Returns:
2101    - dfs (list): A list of pandas DataFrames, each containing the data from a table.
2102    """
2103    from .utils import rename_columns_in_db, correct_metadata
2104    
2105    rename_columns_in_db(db_loc)
2106    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_loc)
2107    dfs = []
2108    
2109    for table in tables:
2110        query = f'SELECT * FROM {table}'
2111        df = pd.read_sql_query(query, conn)
2112        df = correct_metadata(df)
2113        dfs.append(df)
2114        
2115    conn.close()
2116    return dfs

2118def _results_to_csv(src, df, df_well):
2119    """
2120    Save the given dataframes as CSV files in the specified directory.
2121
2122    Args:
2123        src (str): The directory path where the CSV files will be saved.
2124        df (pandas.DataFrame): The dataframe containing cell data.
2125        df_well (pandas.DataFrame): The dataframe containing well data.
2126
2127    Returns:
2128        tuple: A tuple containing the cell dataframe and well dataframe.
2129    """
2130    cells = df
2131    wells = df_well
2132    results_loc = src+'/results'
2133    wells_loc = results_loc+'/wells.csv'
2134    cells_loc = results_loc+'/cells.csv'
2135    os.makedirs(results_loc, exist_ok=True)
2136    wells.to_csv(wells_loc, index=True, header=True)
2137    cells.to_csv(cells_loc, index=True, header=True)
2138    return cells, wells

2140def read_plot_model_stats(train_file_path, val_file_path ,save=False):
2141    
2142    def _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='accuracy', save=False, path=None, dpi=600):
2143        
2144        pdf_path = os.path.join(path, f'{column}.pdf')
2145
2146        # Create subplots
2147        fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(20, 10), sharey=True)
2148
2149        # Plotting
2150        sns.lineplot(ax=axes[0], x='epoch', y=column, data=train_df, marker='o', color='red')
2151        sns.lineplot(ax=axes[1], x='epoch', y=column, data=val_df, marker='o', color='blue')
2152
2153        # Set titles and labels
2154        axes[0].set_title(f'Train {column} vs. Epoch', fontsize=20)
2155        axes[0].set_xlabel('Epoch', fontsize=16)
2156        axes[0].set_ylabel(column, fontsize=16)
2157        axes[0].tick_params(axis='both', which='major', labelsize=12)
2158
2159        axes[1].set_title(f'Validation {column} vs. Epoch', fontsize=20)
2160        axes[1].set_xlabel('Epoch', fontsize=16)
2161        axes[1].tick_params(axis='both', which='major', labelsize=12)
2162
2163        plt.tight_layout()
2164
2165        if save:
2166            plt.savefig(pdf_path, format='pdf', dpi=dpi)
2167        else:
2168            plt.show()
2169
2170    # Read the CSVs into DataFrames
2171    train_df = pd.read_csv(train_file_path, index_col=0)
2172    val_df = pd.read_csv(val_file_path, index_col=0)
2173
2174    # Get the folder path for saving plots
2175    fldr_1 = os.path.dirname(train_file_path)
2176    
2177    if save:
2178        # Setting the style
2179        sns.set(style="whitegrid")
2180    
2181    # Plot and save the results
2182    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='accuracy', save=save, path=fldr_1)
2183    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='neg_accuracy', save=save, path=fldr_1)
2184    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='pos_accuracy', save=save, path=fldr_1)
2185    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='loss', save=save, path=fldr_1)
2186    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='prauc', save=save, path=fldr_1)
2187    _plot_and_save(train_df, val_df, column='optimal_threshold', save=save, path=fldr_1)

2189def _save_model(model, model_type, results_df, dst, epoch, epochs, intermedeate_save=[0.99,0.98,0.95,0.94], channels=['r','g','b']):
2190    """
2191    Save the model based on certain conditions during training.
2192
2193    Args:
2194        model (torch.nn.Module): The trained model to be saved.
2195        model_type (str): The type of the model.
2196        results_df (pandas.DataFrame): The dataframe containing the training results.
2197        dst (str): The destination directory to save the model.
2198        epoch (int): The current epoch number.
2199        epochs (int): The total number of epochs.
2200        intermedeate_save (list, optional): List of accuracy thresholds to trigger intermediate model saves. 
2201                                            Defaults to [0.99, 0.98, 0.95, 0.94].
2202        channels (list, optional): List of channels used. Defaults to ['r', 'g', 'b'].
2203    """
2204
2205    channels_str = ''.join(channels)
2206    
2207    def save_model_at_threshold(threshold, epoch, suffix=""):
2208        percentile = str(threshold * 100)
2209        print(f'Found: {percentile}% accurate model')
2210        model_path = f'{dst}/{model_type}_epoch_{str(epoch)}{suffix}_acc_{percentile}_channels_{channels_str}.pth'
2211        torch.save(model, model_path)
2212        return model_path
2213
2214    if epoch % 100 == 0 or epoch == epochs:
2215        model_path = f'{dst}/{model_type}_epoch_{str(epoch)}_channels_{channels_str}.pth'
2216        torch.save(model, model_path)
2217        return model_path
2218
2219    for threshold in intermedeate_save:
2220        if results_df['neg_accuracy'] >= threshold and results_df['pos_accuracy'] >= threshold:
2221            print(f"Nc class accuracy: {results_df['neg_accuracy']} Pc class Accuracy: {results_df['pos_accuracy']}")
2222            model_path = save_model_at_threshold(threshold, epoch)
2223            break
2224        else:
2225            model_path = None
2226    
2227    return model_path
2228
2229def _save_progress(dst, train_df, validation_df):
2230    """
2231    Save the progress of the classification model.
2232
2233    Parameters:
2234    dst (str): The destination directory to save the progress.
2235    train_df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame containing training stats.
2236    validation_df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame containing validation stats (if available).
2237
2238    Returns:
2239    None
2240    """
2241
2242    def _save_df_to_csv(file_path, df):
2243        """
2244        Save the given DataFrame to the specified CSV file, either creating a new file or appending to an existing one.
2245
2246        Parameters:
2247        file_path (str): The file path where the CSV will be saved.
2248        df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame to save.
2249        """
2250        if not os.path.exists(file_path):
2251            with open(file_path, 'w') as f:
2252                df.to_csv(f, index=True, header=True)
2253                f.flush()  # Ensure data is written to the file system
2254        else:
2255            with open(file_path, 'a') as f:
2256                df.to_csv(f, index=True, header=False)
2257                f.flush()
2258                
2259    # Save accuracy, loss, PRAUC
2260    os.makedirs(dst, exist_ok=True)
2261    results_path_train = os.path.join(dst, 'train.csv')
2262    results_path_validation = os.path.join(dst, 'validation.csv')
2263
2264    # Save training data
2265    _save_df_to_csv(results_path_train, train_df)
2266
2267    # Save validation data if available
2268    if validation_df is not None:
2269        _save_df_to_csv(results_path_validation, validation_df)
2270
2271        # Call read_plot_model_stats after ensuring the files are saved
2272        read_plot_model_stats(results_path_train, results_path_validation, save=True)
2273
2274    return

2276def _copy_missclassified(df):
2277    misclassified = df[df['true_label'] != df['predicted_label']]
2278    for _, row in misclassified.iterrows():
2279        original_path = row['filename']
2280        filename = os.path.basename(original_path)
2281        dest_folder = os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(original_path))
2282        if "pc" in original_path:
2283            new_path = os.path.join(dest_folder, "missclassified/pc", filename)
2284        else:
2285            new_path = os.path.join(dest_folder, "missclassified/nc", filename)
2286        os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(new_path), exist_ok=True)
2287        shutil.copy(original_path, new_path)
2288    print(f"Copied {len(misclassified)} misclassified images.")
2289    return

2306def _read_and_merge_data(locs, tables, verbose=False, nuclei_limit=10, pathogen_limit=10, change_plate=False):
2307
2308    from .utils import _split_data
2309
2310    # Initialize an empty dictionary to store DataFrames by table name
2311    data_dict = {table: [] for table in tables}
2312
2313    # Extract plate DataFrames
2314    for idx, loc in enumerate(locs):
2315        db_dfs = _read_db(loc, tables)
2316        if change_plate:
2317            db_dfs['plateID'] = f'plate{idx+1}'
2318            db_dfs['prc'] = db_dfs['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + db_dfs['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + db_dfs['columnID'].astype(str)
2319        for table, df in zip(tables, db_dfs):
2320            data_dict[table].append(df)
2321
2322    # Concatenate rows across locations for each table
2323    for table, dfs in data_dict.items():
2324        if dfs:
2325            data_dict[table] = pd.concat(dfs, axis=0)
2326            
2327        if verbose:
2328            print(f"{table}: {len(data_dict[table])}")
2329
2330    # Initialize merged DataFrame with 'cells' if available
2331    merged_df = pd.DataFrame()
2332
2333    # Process each table
2334    if 'cell' in data_dict:
2335        cells = data_dict['cell'].copy()
2336        cells = cells.assign(object_label=lambda x: 'o' + x['object_label'].astype(int).astype(str))
2337        cells = cells.assign(prcfo=lambda x: x['prcf'] + '_' + x['object_label'])
2338        cells_g_df, metadata = _split_data(cells, 'prcfo', 'object_label')
2339        merged_df = cells_g_df.copy()
2340        if verbose:
2341            print(f'cells: {len(cells)}, cells grouped: {len(cells_g_df)}')
2342
2343    if 'cytoplasm' in data_dict:
2344        cytoplasms = data_dict['cytoplasm'].copy()
2345        cytoplasms = cytoplasms.assign(object_label=lambda x: 'o' + x['object_label'].astype(int).astype(str))
2346        cytoplasms = cytoplasms.assign(prcfo=lambda x: x['prcf'] + '_' + x['object_label'])
2347        
2348        if not 'cell' in data_dict:
2349            merged_df, metadata = _split_data(cytoplasms, 'prcfo', 'object_label')
2350            
2351            if verbose:
2352                print(f'nucleus: {len(cytoplasms)}, cytoplasms grouped: {len(merged_df)}')
2353            
2354        else:
2355            cytoplasms_g_df, _ = _split_data(cytoplasms, 'prcfo', 'object_label')
2356            merged_df = merged_df.merge(cytoplasms_g_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2357            
2358            if verbose:
2359                print(f'cytoplasms: {len(cytoplasms)}, cytoplasms grouped: {len(cytoplasms_g_df)}')
2360
2361    if 'nucleus' in data_dict:
2362        nucleus = data_dict['nucleus'].copy()
2363        nucleus = nucleus.dropna(subset=['cell_id'])
2364        nucleus = nucleus.assign(object_label=lambda x: 'o' + x['object_label'].astype(int).astype(str))
2365        nucleus = nucleus.assign(cell_id=lambda x: 'o' + x['cell_id'].astype(int).astype(str))
2366        nucleus = nucleus.assign(prcfo=lambda x: x['prcf'] + '_' + x['cell_id'])
2367        nucleus['nucleus_prcfo_count'] = nucleus.groupby('prcfo')['prcfo'].transform('count')
2368        if not nuclei_limit:
2369            nucleus = nucleus[nucleus['nucleus_prcfo_count'] == 1]
2370            
2371        if all(key not in data_dict for key in ['cell', 'cytoplasm']):
2372            merged_df, metadata = _split_data(nucleus, 'prcfo', 'cell_id')
2373            
2374            if verbose:
2375                print(f'nucleus: {len(nucleus)}, nucleus grouped: {len(merged_df)}')
2376            
2377        else:
2378            nucleus_g_df, _ = _split_data(nucleus, 'prcfo', 'cell_id')
2379            merged_df = merged_df.merge(nucleus_g_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2380            
2381            if verbose:
2382                print(f'nucleus: {len(nucleus)}, nucleus grouped: {len(nucleus_g_df)}')
2383
2384    if 'pathogen' in data_dict:
2385        pathogens = data_dict['pathogen'].copy()
2386        pathogens = pathogens.dropna(subset=['cell_id'])
2387        pathogens = pathogens.assign(object_label=lambda x: 'o' + x['object_label'].astype(int).astype(str))
2388        pathogens = pathogens.assign(cell_id=lambda x: 'o' + x['cell_id'].astype(int).astype(str))
2389        pathogens = pathogens.assign(prcfo=lambda x: x['prcf'] + '_' + x['cell_id'])
2390        pathogens['pathogen_prcfo_count'] = pathogens.groupby('prcfo')['prcfo'].transform('count')
2391
2392        if isinstance(pathogen_limit, bool) and not pathogen_limit:
2393            pathogens = pathogens[pathogens['pathogen_prcfo_count'] <= 1]
2394        elif isinstance(pathogen_limit, (float, int)):
2395            pathogens = pathogens[pathogens['pathogen_prcfo_count'] <= int(pathogen_limit)]
2396
2397        if all(key not in data_dict for key in ['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus']):
2398            merged_df, metadata = _split_data(pathogens, 'prcfo', 'cell_id')
2399            
2400            if verbose:
2401                print(f'pathogens: {len(pathogens)}, pathogens grouped: {len(merged_df)}')
2402            
2403        else:
2404            pathogens_g_df, _ = _split_data(pathogens, 'prcfo', 'cell_id')
2405            merged_df = merged_df.merge(pathogens_g_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2406        
2407            if verbose:
2408                print(f'pathogens: {len(pathogens)}, pathogens grouped: {len(pathogens_g_df)}')
2409            
2410    if 'png_list' in data_dict:
2411        png_list = data_dict['png_list'].copy()
2412        png_list_g_df_numeric, png_list_g_df_non_numeric = _split_data(png_list, 'prcfo', 'cell_id')
2413        png_list_g_df_non_numeric.drop(columns=['plateID','rowID','columnID','fieldID','file_name','cell_id', 'prcf'], inplace=True)
2414        if verbose:
2415            print(f'png_list: {len(png_list)}, png_list grouped: {len(png_list_g_df_numeric)}')
2416            print(f"Added png_list columns: {png_list_g_df_numeric.columns}, {png_list_g_df_non_numeric.columns}")
2417        merged_df = merged_df.merge(png_list_g_df_numeric, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2418        merged_df = merged_df.merge(png_list_g_df_non_numeric, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2419    
2420    # Add prc (plate row column) and prcfo (plate row column field object) columns
2421    metadata = metadata.assign(prc=lambda x: x['plateID'] + '_' + x['rowID'] + '_' + x['columnID'])
2422    cells_well = metadata.groupby('prc')['object_label'].nunique().reset_index(name='cells_per_well')
2423    metadata = metadata.merge(cells_well, on='prc')
2424    metadata = metadata.assign(prcfo=lambda x: x['plateID'] + '_' + x['rowID'] + '_' + x['columnID'] + '_' + x['fieldID'] + '_' + x['object_label'])
2425    metadata.set_index('prcfo', inplace=True)
2426    
2427    # Merge metadata with final merged DataFrame
2428    #merged_df = metadata.merge(merged_df, left_index=True, right_index=True).dropna(axis=1)
2429    merged_df = metadata.merge(merged_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2430    merged_df.drop(columns=['label_list_morphology', 'label_list_intensity'], errors='ignore', inplace=True)
2431    
2432    if verbose:
2433        print(f'Generated dataframe with: {len(merged_df.columns)} columns and {len(merged_df)} rows')
2434    
2435    # Prepare object DataFrames for output
2436    obj_df_ls = [data_dict[table] for table in ['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen'] if table in data_dict]
2437    
2438    return merged_df, obj_df_ls

2446def convert_numpy_to_tiff(folder_path, limit=None):
2447    """
2448    Converts all numpy files in a folder to TIFF format and saves them in a subdirectory 'tiff'.
2449    
2450    Args:
2451    folder_path (str): The path to the folder containing numpy files.
2452    """
2453    # Create the subdirectory 'tiff' within the specified folder if it doesn't already exist
2454    tiff_subdir = os.path.join(folder_path, 'tiff')
2455    os.makedirs(tiff_subdir, exist_ok=True)
2456
2457    files = os.listdir(folder_path)
2458
2459    npy_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.npy')]
2460    
2461    # Iterate over all files in the folder
2462    for i, filename in enumerate(files):
2463        if limit is not None and i >= limit:
2464            break
2465        if not filename.endswith('.npy'):
2466            continue
2467
2468        # Construct the full file path
2469        file_path = os.path.join(folder_path, filename)
2470        # Load the numpy file
2471        numpy_array = np.load(file_path)
2472        
2473        # Construct the output TIFF file path
2474        tiff_filename = os.path.splitext(filename)[0] + '.tif'
2475        tiff_file_path = os.path.join(tiff_subdir, tiff_filename)
2476        
2477        # Save the numpy array as a TIFF file
2478        tifffile.imwrite(tiff_file_path, numpy_array)
2479        
2480        print(f"Converted {filename} to {tiff_filename} and saved in 'tiff' subdirectory.")
2481    return

2483def generate_cellpose_train_test(src, test_split=0.1):
2484    mask_src = os.path.join(src, 'masks')
2485    img_paths = glob.glob(os.path.join(src, '*.tif'))
2486    img_filenames = [os.path.basename(file) for file in img_paths]
2487    img_filenames = [file for file in img_filenames if os.path.exists(os.path.join(mask_src, file))]
2488    print(f'Found {len(img_filenames)} images with masks')
2489    
2490    random.shuffle(img_filenames)
2491    split_index = int(len(img_filenames) * test_split)
2492    train_files = img_filenames[split_index:]
2493    test_files = img_filenames[:split_index]
2494    list_of_lists = [test_files, train_files]
2495    print(f'Split dataset into Train {len(train_files)} and Test {len(test_files)} files')
2496    
2497    train_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(src), 'train')
2498    train_dir_masks = os.path.join(train_dir, 'masks')
2499    test_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(src), 'test')
2500    test_dir_masks = os.path.join(test_dir, 'masks')
2501    
2502    os.makedirs(train_dir, exist_ok=True)
2503    os.makedirs(train_dir_masks, exist_ok=True)
2504    os.makedirs(test_dir, exist_ok=True)
2505    os.makedirs(test_dir_masks, exist_ok=True)
2506    
2507    for i, ls in enumerate(list_of_lists):
2508        if i == 0:
2509            dst = test_dir
2510            dst_mask = test_dir_masks
2511            _type = 'Test'
2512        else:
2513            dst = train_dir
2514            dst_mask = train_dir_masks
2515            _type = 'Train'
2516            
2517        for idx, filename in enumerate(ls):
2518            img_path = os.path.join(src, filename)
2519            mask_path = os.path.join(mask_src, filename)
2520            new_img_path = os.path.join(dst, filename)
2521            new_mask_path = os.path.join(dst_mask, filename)            
2522            shutil.copy(img_path, new_img_path)
2523            shutil.copy(mask_path, new_mask_path)
2524            print(f'Copied {idx+1}/{len(ls)} images to {_type} set')#, end='\r', flush=True)

2526def parse_gz_files(folder_path):
2527    """
2528    Parses the .fastq.gz files in the specified folder path and returns a dictionary
2529    containing the sample names and their corresponding file paths.
2530
2531    Args:
2532        folder_path (str): The path to the folder containing the .fastq.gz files.
2533
2534    Returns:
2535        dict: A dictionary where the keys are the sample names and the values are
2536        dictionaries containing the file paths for the 'R1' and 'R2' read directions.
2537    """
2538    files = os.listdir(folder_path)
2539    gz_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.fastq.gz')]
2540
2541    samples_dict = {}
2542    for gz_file in gz_files:
2543        parts = gz_file.split('_')
2544        sample_name = parts[0]
2545        read_direction = parts[1]
2546
2547        if sample_name not in samples_dict:
2548            samples_dict[sample_name] = {}
2549
2550        if read_direction == "R1":
2551            samples_dict[sample_name]['R1'] = os.path.join(folder_path, gz_file)
2552        elif read_direction == "R2":
2553            samples_dict[sample_name]['R2'] = os.path.join(folder_path, gz_file)
2554    return samples_dict
2555
2556def generate_dataset(settings={}):
2557    
2558    from .utils import initiate_counter, add_images_to_tar, save_settings, generate_path_list_from_db, correct_paths
2559    from .settings import set_generate_dataset_defaults
2560
2561    settings = set_generate_dataset_defaults(settings)
2562    save_settings(settings, 'generate_dataset', show=True)
2563
2564    if isinstance(settings['src'], str):
2565        settings['src'] = [settings['src']]
2566    if isinstance(settings['src'], list):
2567        all_paths = []
2568        for i, src in enumerate(settings['src']):
2569            db_path = os.path.join(src, 'measurements', 'measurements.db')
2570            if i == 0:
2571                dst = os.path.join(src, 'datasets')
2572            paths = generate_path_list_from_db(db_path, file_metadata=settings['file_metadata'])
2573            correct_paths(paths, src)
2574            all_paths.extend(paths)
2575        if isinstance(settings['sample'], int):
2576            selected_paths = random.sample(all_paths, settings['sample'])
2577            print(f"Random selection of {len(selected_paths)} paths")
2578        elif isinstance(settings['sample'], list):
2579            sample = settings['sample'][i]
2580            selected_paths = random.sample(all_paths, settings['sample'])
2581            print(f"Random selection of {len(selected_paths)} paths")
2582        else:
2583            selected_paths = all_paths
2584            random.shuffle(selected_paths)
2585            print(f"All paths: {len(selected_paths)} paths")
2586
2587    total_images = len(selected_paths)
2588    print(f"Found {total_images} images")
2589
2590    # Create a temp folder in dst
2591    temp_dir = os.path.join(dst, "temp_tars")
2592    os.makedirs(temp_dir, exist_ok=True)
2593
2594    # Chunking the data
2595    num_procs = max(2, cpu_count() - 2)
2596    chunk_size = len(selected_paths) // num_procs
2597    remainder = len(selected_paths) % num_procs
2598
2599    paths_chunks = []
2600    start = 0
2601    for i in range(num_procs):
2602        end = start + chunk_size + (1 if i < remainder else 0)
2603        paths_chunks.append(selected_paths[start:end])
2604        start = end
2605
2606    temp_tar_files = [os.path.join(temp_dir, f"temp_{i}.tar") for i in range(num_procs)]
2607
2608    print(f"Generating temporary tar files in {dst}")
2609
2610    # Initialize shared counter and lock
2611    counter = Value('i', 0)
2612    lock = Lock()
2613
2614    with Pool(processes=num_procs, initializer=initiate_counter, initargs=(counter, lock)) as pool:
2615        pool.starmap(add_images_to_tar, [(paths_chunks[i], temp_tar_files[i], total_images) for i in range(num_procs)])
2616
2617    # Combine the temporary tar files into a final tar
2618    date_name = datetime.date.today().strftime('%y%m%d')
2619    if len(settings['src']) > 1:
2620        date_name = f"{date_name}_combined"
2621    #if not settings['file_metadata'] is None:
2622    #    tar_name = f"{date_name}_{settings['experiment']}_{settings['file_metadata']}.tar"
2623    #else:
2624    tar_name = f"{date_name}_{settings['experiment']}.tar"
2625    tar_name = os.path.join(dst, tar_name)
2626    if os.path.exists(tar_name):
2627        number = random.randint(1, 100)
2628        tar_name_2 = f"{date_name}_{settings['experiment']}_{settings['file_metadata']}_{number}.tar"
2629        print(f"Warning: {os.path.basename(tar_name)} exists, saving as {os.path.basename(tar_name_2)} ")
2630        tar_name = os.path.join(dst, tar_name_2)
2631
2632    print(f"Merging temporary files")
2633
2634    with tarfile.open(tar_name, 'w') as final_tar:
2635        for temp_tar_path in temp_tar_files:
2636            with tarfile.open(temp_tar_path, 'r') as temp_tar:
2637                for member in temp_tar.getmembers():
2638                    file_obj = temp_tar.extractfile(member)
2639                    final_tar.addfile(member, file_obj)
2640            os.remove(temp_tar_path)
2641
2642    # Delete the temp folder
2643    shutil.rmtree(temp_dir)
2644    print(f"\nSaved {total_images} images to {tar_name}")
2645
2646    return tar_name
2647
2648def generate_loaders(src, mode='train', image_size=224, batch_size=32, classes=['nc','pc'], n_jobs=None, validation_split=0.0, pin_memory=False, normalize=False, channels=[1, 2, 3], augment=False, verbose=False):
2649    
2650    """
2651    Generate data loaders for training and validation/test datasets.
2652
2653    Parameters:
2654    - src (str): The source directory containing the data.
2655    - mode (str): The mode of operation. Options are 'train' or 'test'.
2656    - image_size (int): The size of the input images.
2657    - batch_size (int): The batch size for the data loaders.
2658    - classes (list): The list of classes to consider.
2659    - n_jobs (int): The number of worker threads for data loading.
2660    - validation_split (float): The fraction of data to use for validation.
2661    - pin_memory (bool): Whether to pin memory for faster data transfer.
2662    - normalize (bool): Whether to normalize the input images.
2663    - verbose (bool): Whether to print additional information and show images.
2664    - channels (list): The list of channels to retain. Options are [1, 2, 3] for all channels, [1, 2] for blue and green, etc.
2665
2666    Returns:
2667    - train_loaders (list): List of data loaders for training datasets.
2668    - val_loaders (list): List of data loaders for validation datasets.
2669    """
2670
2671    from .utils import SelectChannels, augment_dataset
2672
2673    chans = []
2674
2675    if 'r' in channels:
2676        chans.append(1)
2677    if 'g' in channels:
2678        chans.append(2)
2679    if 'b' in channels:
2680        chans.append(3)
2681
2682    channels = chans
2683
2684    if verbose:
2685        print(f'Training a network on channels: {channels}')
2686        print(f'Channel 1: Red, Channel 2: Green, Channel 3: Blue')
2687        
2688    train_loaders = []
2689    val_loaders = []
2690
2691    if normalize:
2692        transform = transforms.Compose([
2693            transforms.ToTensor(),
2694            transforms.CenterCrop(size=(image_size, image_size)),
2695            SelectChannels(channels),
2696            transforms.Normalize(mean=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5), std=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5))])
2697    else:
2698        transform = transforms.Compose([
2699            transforms.ToTensor(),
2700            transforms.CenterCrop(size=(image_size, image_size)),
2701            SelectChannels(channels)])
2702
2703    if mode == 'train':
2704        data_dir = os.path.join(src, 'train')
2705        shuffle = True
2706        print('Loading Train and validation datasets')
2707    elif mode == 'test':
2708        data_dir = os.path.join(src, 'test')
2709        val_loaders = []
2710        validation_split = 0.0
2711        shuffle = True
2712        print('Loading test dataset')
2713    else:
2714        print(f'mode:{mode} is not valid, use mode = train or test')
2715        return
2716    
2717    class_1_path = os.path.join(data_dir, classes[0])
2718    class_2_path = os.path.join(data_dir, classes[1])
2719    if not os.path.exists(class_1_path) or not os.path.exists(class_2_path):
2720        print(f'One or more classes not found in {data_dir}')
2721        print (f'Possible class names are {os.listdir(data_dir)}')
2722
2723    data = spacrDataset(data_dir, classes, transform=transform, shuffle=shuffle, pin_memory=pin_memory)
2724    num_workers = n_jobs if n_jobs is not None else 0
2725    
2726    if validation_split > 0:
2727        train_size = int((1 - validation_split) * len(data))
2728        val_size = len(data) - train_size
2729        if not augment:
2730            print(f'Train data:{train_size}, Validation data:{val_size}')
2731        train_dataset, val_dataset = random_split(data, [train_size, val_size])
2732
2733        if augment:
2734
2735            print(f'Data before augmentation: Train: {len(train_dataset)}, Validataion:{len(val_dataset)}')
2736            train_dataset = augment_dataset(train_dataset, is_grayscale=(len(channels) == 1))
2737            print(f'Data after augmentation: Train: {len(train_dataset)}')
2738            
2739        print(f'Generating Dataloader with {n_jobs} workers')
2740        train_loaders = DataLoader(train_dataset, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=shuffle, num_workers=1, pin_memory=pin_memory, persistent_workers=True)
2741        val_loaders = DataLoader(val_dataset, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=shuffle, num_workers=1, pin_memory=pin_memory, persistent_workers=True)
2742    else:
2743        train_loaders = DataLoader(data, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=shuffle, num_workers=1, pin_memory=pin_memory, persistent_workers=True)
2744
2745    #dataset (Dataset) – dataset from which to load the data.
2746    #batch_size (int, optional) – how many samples per batch to load (default: 1).
2747    #shuffle (bool, optional) – set to True to have the data reshuffled at every epoch (default: False).
2748    #sampler (Sampler or Iterable, optional) – defines the strategy to draw samples from the dataset. Can be any Iterable with __len__ implemented. If specified, shuffle must not be specified.
2749    #batch_sampler (Sampler or Iterable, optional) – like sampler, but returns a batch of indices at a time. Mutually exclusive with batch_size, shuffle, sampler, and drop_last.
2750    #num_workers (int, optional) – how many subprocesses to use for data loading. 0 means that the data will be loaded in the main process. (default: 0)
2751    #collate_fn (Callable, optional) – merges a list of samples to form a mini-batch of Tensor(s). Used when using batched loading from a map-style dataset.
2752    #pin_memory (bool, optional) – If True, the data loader will copy Tensors into device/CUDA pinned memory before returning them. If your data elements are a custom type, or your collate_fn returns a batch that is a custom type, see the example below.
2753    #drop_last (bool, optional) – set to True to drop the last incomplete batch, if the dataset size is not divisible by the batch size. If False and the size of dataset is not divisible by the batch size, then the last batch will be smaller. (default: False)
2754    #timeout (numeric, optional) – if positive, the timeout value for collecting a batch from workers. Should always be non-negative. (default: 0)
2755    #worker_init_fn (Callable, optional) – If not None, this will be called on each worker subprocess with the worker id (an int in [0, num_workers - 1]) as input, after seeding and before data loading. (default: None)
2756    #multiprocessing_context (str or multiprocessing.context.BaseContext, optional) – If None, the default multiprocessing context of your operating system will be used. (default: None)
2757    #generator (torch.Generator, optional) – If not None, this RNG will be used by RandomSampler to generate random indexes and multiprocessing to generate base_seed for workers. (default: None)
2758    #prefetch_factor (int, optional, keyword-only arg) – Number of batches loaded in advance by each worker. 2 means there will be a total of 2 * num_workers batches prefetched across all workers. (default value depends on the set value for num_workers. If value of num_workers=0 default is None. Otherwise, if value of num_workers > 0 default is 2).
2759    #persistent_workers (bool, optional) – If True, the data loader will not shut down the worker processes after a dataset has been consumed once. This allows to maintain the workers Dataset instances alive. (default: False)
2760    #pin_memory_device (str, optional) – the device to pin_memory to if pin_memory is True.
2761
2762    #images, labels, filenames = next(iter(train_loaders))
2763    #images = images.cpu()
2764    #label_strings = [str(label.item()) for label in labels]
2765    #train_fig = _imshow_gpu(images, label_strings, nrow=20, fontsize=12)
2766    #if verbose:
2767    #    plt.show()
2768    
2769    train_fig = None
2770
2771    return train_loaders, val_loaders, train_fig

2773def generate_training_dataset(settings):
2774    
2775    # Function to filter png_list_df by prcfo present in df without merging
2776    def filter_png_list(db_path, settings, tables = ['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'cytoplasm']):
2777        df, _ = _read_and_merge_data(locs=[db_path],
2778                                     tables=tables,
2779                                     verbose=False,
2780                                     nuclei_limit=settings['nuclei_limit'],
2781                                     pathogen_limit=settings['pathogen_limit'])
2782                
2783        [png_list_df] = _read_db(db_loc=db_path, tables=['png_list'])
2784        filtered_png_list_df = png_list_df[png_list_df['prcfo'].isin(df.index)]
2785        return filtered_png_list_df
2786
2787    # Function to get the smallest class size based on the dataset mode
2788    def get_smallest_class_size(df, settings, dataset_mode):
2789        if dataset_mode == 'metadata':
2790            sizes = [len(df[df['condition'] == c]) for c in settings['class_metadata']]
2791            #sizes = [len(df[df['condition'].isin(class_list)]) for class_list in settings['class_metadata']]
2792            print(f'Class sizes: {sizes}')
2793        elif dataset_mode == 'annotation':
2794            sizes = [len(class_paths) for class_paths in df]
2795        size = min(sizes)
2796        print(f'Using the smallest class size: {size}')
2797        return size
2798    
2799    # Measurement-based selection logic
2800    def measurement_based_selection(settings, db_path, tables = ['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'cytoplasm']):
2801        class_paths_ls = []
2802        df, _ = _read_and_merge_data(locs=[db_path],
2803                                     tables=tables,
2804                                     verbose=False,
2805                                     nuclei_limit=settings['nuclei_limit'],
2806                                     pathogen_limit=settings['pathogen_limit'])
2807
2808        print('length df 1', len(df))
2809        df = annotate_conditions(df, cells=['HeLa'], pathogens=['pathogen'], treatments=settings['classes'],
2810                                 treatment_loc=settings['class_metadata'])#, types=settings['metadata_type_by'])
2811        print('length df 2', len(df))
2812        
2813        png_list_df = filter_png_list(db_path, settings, tables=settings['tables'])
2814
2815        if settings['custom_measurement']:
2816            if isinstance(settings['custom_measurement'], list):
2817                if len(settings['custom_measurement']) == 2:
2818                    df['recruitment'] = df[f"{settings['custom_measurement'][0]}"] / df[f"{settings['custom_measurement'][1]}"]
2819                else:
2820                    df['recruitment'] = df[f"{settings['custom_measurement'][0]}"]
2821            else:
2822                print("custom_measurement should be a list.")
2823                return
2824
2825        else:
2826            df['recruitment'] = df[f"pathogen_channel_{settings['channel_of_interest']}_mean_intensity"] / df[f"cytoplasm_channel_{settings['channel_of_interest']}_mean_intensity"]
2827
2828        q25 = df['recruitment'].quantile(0.25)
2829        q75 = df['recruitment'].quantile(0.75)
2830        df_lower = df[df['recruitment'] <= q25]
2831        df_upper = df[df['recruitment'] >= q75]
2832
2833        class_paths_lower = get_paths_from_db(df=df_lower, png_df=png_list_df, image_type=settings['png_type'])
2834        class_paths_lower = random.sample(class_paths_lower['png_path'].tolist(), settings['size'])
2835        class_paths_ls.append(class_paths_lower)
2836
2837        class_paths_upper = get_paths_from_db(df=df_upper, png_df=png_list_df, image_type=settings['png_type'])
2838        class_paths_upper = random.sample(class_paths_upper['png_path'].tolist(), settings['size'])
2839        class_paths_ls.append(class_paths_upper)
2840
2841        return class_paths_ls
2842
2843    # Metadata-based selection logic
2844    def metadata_based_selection(db_path, settings):
2845        class_paths_ls = []
2846        df = filter_png_list(db_path, settings, tables=settings['tables'])
2847                
2848        df = annotate_conditions(df,
2849                                 cells=None,
2850                                 cell_loc=None,
2851                                 pathogens=settings['metadata_item_1_name'],
2852                                 pathogen_loc=settings['metadata_item_1_value'],
2853                                 treatments=settings['metadata_item_2_name'],
2854                                 treatment_loc=settings['metadata_item_2_value'])
2855        
2856        #if settings['metadata_type_by'] == 'condition':
2857        df = df.dropna(subset=['condition'])
2858            
2859        display(df)
2860
2861        size = get_smallest_class_size(df, settings, 'metadata')
2862        
2863        for class_ in settings['class_metadata']:
2864            class_temp_df = df[df['condition'] == class_]
2865            #class_temp_df = df[df['condition'].isin(class_)]
2866            print(f'Found {len(class_temp_df)} images for class {class_}')
2867            class_paths_temp = class_temp_df['png_path'].tolist()
2868
2869            # Ensure to sample `size` number of images (smallest class size)
2870            if len(class_paths_temp) > size:
2871                class_paths_temp = random.sample(class_paths_temp, size)
2872
2873            class_paths_ls.append(class_paths_temp)
2874
2875        return class_paths_ls
2876
2877    # Annotation-based selection logic
2878    def annotation_based_selection(db_path, dst, settings):
2879        class_paths_ls = training_dataset_from_annotation(db_path, dst, settings['annotation_column'], annotated_classes=settings['annotated_classes'])
2880
2881        return class_paths_ls
2882    
2883    # Metadata-Annotation-based selection logic
2884    def metadata_annotation_based_selection(db_path, dst, settings):
2885        class_paths_ls = training_dataset_from_annotation_metadata(db_path, dst, settings['annotation_column'], annotated_classes=settings['annotated_classes'], metadata_type_by=settings['metadata_type_by'], class_metadata=settings['class_metadata'])
2886
2887        return class_paths_ls
2888    
2889    from .io import _read_and_merge_data, _read_db
2890    from .utils import get_paths_from_db, annotate_conditions, save_settings
2891    from .settings import set_generate_training_dataset_defaults
2892    
2893    settings = set_generate_training_dataset_defaults(settings)
2894
2895    if 'nucleus' not in settings['tables']:
2896        settings['nuclei_limit'] = False
2897        
2898    if 'pathogen' not in settings['tables']:
2899        settings['pathogen_limit'] = 0
2900       
2901    # Set default settings and save
2902    save_settings(settings, 'cv_dataset', show=True)
2903
2904    class_path_list = None
2905
2906    if isinstance(settings['src'], str):
2907        src = [settings['src']]
2908        settings['src'] = src
2909
2910    for i, src in enumerate(settings['src']):
2911        db_path = os.path.join(src, 'measurements', 'measurements.db')
2912        
2913        if len(settings['src']) > 1 and i == 0:
2914            dst = os.path.join(src, 'datasets', 'training_all')
2915        elif len(settings['src']) == 1:
2916            dst = os.path.join(src, 'datasets', 'training')
2917
2918        # Create a new directory for training data if necessary
2919        if os.path.exists(dst):
2920            for i in range(1, 100000):
2921                dst = dst + f'_{i}'
2922                if not os.path.exists(dst):
2923                    print(f'Creating new directory for training: {dst}')
2924                    break
2925
2926        # Select dataset based on dataset mode
2927        if settings['dataset_mode'] == 'annotation':
2928            class_paths_ls = annotation_based_selection(db_path, dst, settings)
2929
2930        elif settings['dataset_mode'] == 'metadata':
2931            class_paths_ls = metadata_based_selection(db_path, settings)
2932
2933        elif settings['dataset_mode'] == 'measurement':
2934            class_paths_ls = measurement_based_selection(settings, db_path, tables=settings['tables'])
2935            
2936        elif settings['dataset_mode'] == 'metadata_annotation':
2937            class_paths_ls = metadata_annotation_based_selection(db_path, dst, settings)
2938            
2939        else:
2940            print(f"Invalid dataset mode: {settings['dataset_mode']}")
2941            print(f"Valid options are: 'annotation', 'metadata', 'measurement', 'metadata_annotation'")
2942            return
2943        
2944        if class_path_list is None:
2945            class_path_list = [[] for _ in range(len(class_paths_ls))]
2946
2947        # Extend each list in class_path_list with the corresponding list from class_paths_ls
2948        for idx in range(len(class_paths_ls)):
2949            class_path_list[idx].extend(class_paths_ls[idx])
2950
2951    # Generate and return training and testing directories
2952    print('class_path_list',len(class_path_list))
2953    train_class_dir, test_class_dir = generate_dataset_from_lists(dst, class_data=class_path_list, classes=settings['class_metadata'], test_split=settings['test_split'])
2954
2955    return train_class_dir, test_class_dir

2957def training_dataset_from_annotation(db_path, dst, annotation_column='test', annotated_classes=(1, 2)):
2958    all_paths = []
2959
2960    # Connect to the database and retrieve the image paths and annotations
2961    print(f'Reading DataBase: {db_path}')
2962    with sqlite3.connect(db_path) as conn:
2963        cursor = conn.cursor()
2964        # Retrieve all paths and annotations from the database
2965        query = f"SELECT png_path, {annotation_column} FROM png_list"
2966        cursor.execute(query)
2967        
2968        while True:
2969            rows = cursor.fetchmany(1000)
2970            if not rows:
2971                break
2972            for row in rows:
2973                all_paths.append(row)
2974
2975    print('Total paths retrieved:', len(all_paths))
2976    
2977    # Filter paths based on annotated_classes
2978    class_paths = []
2979    for class_ in annotated_classes:
2980        class_paths_temp = [path for path, annotation in all_paths if annotation == class_]
2981        class_paths.append(class_paths_temp)
2982        print(f'Found {len(class_paths_temp)} images in class {class_}')
2983        
2984    # If only one class is provided, create an alternative list by sampling paths from all_paths that are not in the annotated class
2985    if len(annotated_classes) == 1:
2986        target_class = annotated_classes[0]
2987        count_target_class = len(class_paths[0])
2988        print(f'Annotated class: {target_class} with {count_target_class} images')
2989        
2990        # Filter all_paths to exclude paths that belong to the target class
2991        alt_class_paths = [path for path, annotation in all_paths if annotation != target_class]
2992        print('Alternative paths available:', len(alt_class_paths))
2993        
2994        # Sample the same number of images for both classes
2995        balanced_count = min(count_target_class, len(alt_class_paths))
2996        print(f'Sampling {balanced_count} images for each class')
2997
2998        # Resample target class to match the smaller size
2999        sampled_target_class_paths = random.sample(class_paths[0], balanced_count)
3000        sampled_alt_class_paths = random.sample(alt_class_paths, balanced_count)
3001        
3002        # Update class paths
3003        class_paths[0] = sampled_target_class_paths
3004        class_paths.append(sampled_alt_class_paths)
3005
3006    print(f'Generated a list of lists from annotation of {len(class_paths)} classes')
3007    for i, ls in enumerate(class_paths):
3008        print(f'Class {i}: {len(ls)} images')
3009        
3010    return class_paths
3011
3012def training_dataset_from_annotation_metadata(db_path, dst, annotation_column='test', annotated_classes=(1, 2), metadata_type_by='columnID', class_metadata=['c1','c2']):
3013    all_paths = []
3014
3015    # Connect to the database and retrieve the image paths and annotations
3016    print(f'Reading DataBase: {db_path}')
3017    with sqlite3.connect(db_path) as conn:
3018        cursor = conn.cursor()
3019        # Retrieve all paths and annotations from the database
3020        query = f"SELECT png_path, {annotation_column}, row_name, column_name FROM png_list"
3021        cursor.execute(query)
3022        
3023        while True:
3024            rows = cursor.fetchmany(1000)
3025            if not rows:
3026                break
3027            for row in rows:
3028                all_paths.append(row)
3029
3030    print('Total paths retrieved:', len(all_paths))
3031    
3032    # Filter all_paths by metadata_type_by and class_metadata
3033    filtered_paths = []
3034    metadata_index = {'rowID': 2, 'columnID': 3}.get(metadata_type_by, None)
3035    if metadata_index is None:
3036        raise ValueError(f"Invalid metadata_type_by value: {metadata_type_by}. Must be 'rowID' or 'columnID'. {class_metadata} must be a list formatted as ['c1', 'c2'] or ['r1', 'r2']")
3037
3038    for row in all_paths:
3039        if row[metadata_index] in class_metadata:
3040            filtered_paths.append(row)
3041
3042    print('Total filtered paths:', len(filtered_paths))
3043    #all_paths = filtered_paths
3044    all_paths = [(row[0], row[1]) for row in filtered_paths]
3045    
3046    # Filter paths based on annotated_classes
3047    class_paths = []
3048    for class_ in annotated_classes:
3049        class_paths_temp = [path for path, annotation in all_paths if annotation == class_]
3050        class_paths.append(class_paths_temp)
3051        print(f'Found {len(class_paths_temp)} images in class {class_}')
3052        
3053    # If only one class is provided, create an alternative list by sampling paths from all_paths that are not in the annotated class
3054    if len(annotated_classes) == 1:
3055        target_class = annotated_classes[0]
3056        count_target_class = len(class_paths[0])
3057        print(f'Annotated class: {target_class} with {count_target_class} images')
3058        
3059        # Filter all_paths to exclude paths that belong to the target class
3060        alt_class_paths = [path for path, annotation in all_paths if annotation != target_class]
3061        print('Alternative paths available:', len(alt_class_paths))
3062        
3063        # Sample the same number of images for both classes
3064        balanced_count = min(count_target_class, len(alt_class_paths))
3065        print(f'Sampling {balanced_count} images for each class')
3066
3067        # Resample target class to match the smaller size
3068        sampled_target_class_paths = random.sample(class_paths[0], balanced_count)
3069        sampled_alt_class_paths = random.sample(alt_class_paths, balanced_count)
3070        
3071        # Update class paths
3072        class_paths[0] = sampled_target_class_paths
3073        class_paths.append(sampled_alt_class_paths)
3074
3075    print(f'Generated a list of lists from annotation of {len(class_paths)} classes')
3076    for i, ls in enumerate(class_paths):
3077        print(f'Class {i}: {len(ls)} images')
3078        
3079    return class_paths

3081def generate_dataset_from_lists(dst, class_data, classes, test_split=0.1):
3082    from .utils import print_progress
3083    # Make sure that the length of class_data matches the length of classes
3084    if len(class_data) != len(classes):
3085        raise ValueError("class_data and classes must have the same length.")
3086
3087    total_files = sum(len(data) for data in class_data)
3088    processed_files = 0
3089    time_ls = []
3090    
3091    for cls, data in zip(classes, class_data):
3092        # Create directories
3093        train_class_dir = os.path.join(dst, f'train/{cls}')
3094        test_class_dir = os.path.join(dst, f'test/{cls}')
3095        os.makedirs(train_class_dir, exist_ok=True)
3096        os.makedirs(test_class_dir, exist_ok=True)
3097                
3098        # Split the data
3099        print('data',len(data), test_split)
3100        train_data, test_data = train_test_split(data, test_size=test_split, shuffle=True, random_state=42)
3101        
3102        # Copy train files
3103        for path in train_data:
3104            start = time.time()
3105            shutil.copy(path, os.path.join(train_class_dir, os.path.basename(path)))
3106            duration = time.time() - start
3107            time_ls.append(duration)
3108            print_progress(processed_files, total_files, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type="Copying files for Train dataset")
3109            processed_files += 1
3110
3111        # Copy test files
3112        for path in test_data:
3113            start = time.time()
3114            shutil.copy(path, os.path.join(test_class_dir, os.path.basename(path)))
3115            duration = time.time() - start
3116            time_ls.append(duration)
3117            print_progress(processed_files, total_files, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type="Copying files for Test dataset")
3118            processed_files += 1
3119
3120    # Print summary
3121    for cls in classes:
3122        train_class_dir = os.path.join(dst, f'train/{cls}')
3123        test_class_dir = os.path.join(dst, f'test/{cls}')
3124        print(f'Train class {cls}: {len(os.listdir(train_class_dir))}, Test class {cls}: {len(os.listdir(test_class_dir))}')
3125
3126    return os.path.join(dst, 'train'), os.path.join(dst, 'test')
